heading: rants and raves
subheading: date: fri, 12 nov 1999 12:25:53 -0800 from: “craig carpenter” (vbxprt@home.com) to: newsfeedback@wired.com subject: ietf says ‘no way’ to net taps this is in reference to “ietf says ‘no way’ to net taps,” 11.nov.1999 . it kind of makes me wonder why our government would even desire to engage in this kind of behaivor. it’s […]
author: wired blogs
text: date: fri, 12 nov 1999 12:25:53 -0800 from: "craig carpenter" (vbxprt@home.com)to: newsfeedback@wired.comsubject: ietf says 'no way' to net tapsthis is in reference to "ietf says 'no way' to net taps," 11.nov.1999 .it kind of makes me wonder why our government would even desire to engage in this kind of behaivor. it's alarming to me that we must keep slapping their hand time and time again. it is obvious that the government is trying to engage in behaivor that is not good in the public eye.why must we always treat our government as the enemy; always fighting them off. if they are honestly trying to look after our well being, then why would they keep trying to pull off this kind of bad stuff?
